background_features.name: Battle Initiate
background_features.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Weapon Proficiency. You gain proficiency with two weapons of your choice.

Mastery Property. Your training with weapons allows you to choose to gain a mastery property from your choice of two kinds of Simple or Martial weapons that you have proficiency with.

Fighting Style. You gain a Fighting Style Feat of your choice.

Battle Maneuver. You gain a Maneuver Option of your choice and one Superiority Dice, which are d8s, and are used for your Maneuvers. You regain your Superiority Dice after you finish a Short or Long Rest.

Chosen Weapons: Shotgun and Lance

Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting
- Ravager: Crit on 19 / 20 with Two Handed Weapons

Manuever: Evasive Footwork

background_features.name: Evasive Footwork
background_features.description:
As a Bonus Action, you can expend one Superiority Die and take the Disengage action. You also roll the die and add the number rolled to your AC until the start of your next turn.

Regain Superiority dice on short or long rest.

racial_features.name: Mirage of the Mists
racial_features.description: Whenever a creature casts a spell or attack that targets you, you can use a reaction to have the creature make a Wisdom Saving Throw (DC = 8 + Proficiency Bonus + your modifier for you ability chosen in your Elven Lineage feature). On a fail, that creature must change the target of that spell or attack within its range. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

racial_features.name: Fey Ancestry
racial_features.description: You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

racial_features.name: Keen Senses
racial_features.description:
You have proficiency in the Insight, Perception, or Survival skill.

Chosen Skill: Perception

racial_features.name: Trance
racial_features.description: You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep. You can finish a Long Rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in a trancelike meditation, during which you retain consciousness.

racial_features.name: Wood Elf Lineage
racial_features.description: Your Speed increases to 35 feet. You also know the Druidcraft cantrip.

class_features.name: Pact of the Blade
class_features.description:
As a Bonus Action, you can conjure a pact weapon in your hand‚Äîa Simple or Martial Melee weapon of your choice with which you bond‚Äîor create a bond with a magic weapon you touch; you can‚Äôt bond with a magic weapon if someone else is attuned to it or another Warlock is bonded with it. Until the bond ends, you have proficiency with the weapon, and you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus.

Whenever you attack with the bonded weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity; and you can cause the weapon to deal Necrotic, Psychic, or Radiant damage or its normal damage type.

Your bond with the weapon ends if you use this feature‚Äôs Bonus Action again, if the weapon is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more, or if you die. A conjured weapon disappears when the bond ends.

class_features.name: Eldritch Mind
class_features.description: You have Advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain Concentration. Additionally, you can cast a 1st level spell or cantrip you know that requires concentration as a bonus action. You can't cast a spell this way again until you finish a long rest.

class_features.name: Otherworldly Leap
class_features.description: You can cast Jump on yourself without expending a spell slot.

class_features.name: Magical Cunning
class_features.description: You can perform an esoteric rite for 1 minute. At the end of it, you regain expended Pact Magic spell slots but no more than a number equal to half your maximum (round up). Once you use this feature, you can‚Äôt do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

level_0_spells.name: Thorn Whip
level_0_spells.components: V, S, M (the stem of a thorny plant)
level_0_spells.description:
You create a vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Piercing damage, and if it is Large or smaller, you can pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

Cantrip Upgrade: You can create an additional whip at levels 5 (2 whips), 11 (3 whips) , and 17 (4 whips). The whips must attack a different creature.

level_0_spells.name: Blade Ward
level_0_spells.description: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against you before the spell ends, the attacker subtracts 1d4 from the attack roll.

level_0_spells.name: Druidcraft
level_0_spells.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor: You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom: You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect: You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play: You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

level_0_spells.name: Poison Spray
level_0_spells.description:
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Each creature in a 10 foot cone from you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d8 Poison damage and subtract 1d4 from the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade: The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

level_1_spells.name: Entangle
level_1_spells.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into Difficult Terrain. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the Restrained condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

level_1_spells.name: Fog Cloud
level_1_spells.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is Heavily Obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by Gust of Wind) disperses it.

Higher-Level Spell Slot: The fog‚Äôs radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

level_1_spells.name: Longstrider
level_1_spells.components: V, S, M (a pinch of dirt)
level_1_spells.description:
You touch a creature. The target‚Äôs Speed increases by 10 feet until the spell ends.

Higher-Level Spell Slot: You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

level_1_spells.name: Speak With Animals
level_1_spells.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action‚Äôs skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don‚Äôt pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

level_1_spells.name: Armor Of Agathys
level_1_spells.components: V, S, M (a shard of blue glass)
level_1_spells.description:
Protective magical frost surrounds you. You gain 5 Temporary Hit Points. If a creature hits you with a melee attack roll before the spell ends, the creature takes 5 Cold damage. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points.

Higher-Level Spell Slot: The Temporary Hit Points and the Cold damage both increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 1.

level_2_spells.name: Spike Growth
level_2_spells.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 Piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can‚Äôt see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

level_2_spells.name: Lesser Restoration
level_2_spells.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: Blinded, Deafened, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

level_2_spells.name: Summon Beast
level_2_spells.components: V, S, M (a feather, tuft of fur, and fish tail inside a gilded acorn worth 200+ GP)
level_2_spells.description:
You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the Bestial Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature resembles an animal of your choice that is native to the chosen environment, which determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 Hit Points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your Initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don‚Äôt issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

Higher-Level Spell Slot: Use the spell slot‚Äôs level for the spell‚Äôs level in the stat block.

level_2_spells.name: Mirror Image
level_2_spells.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it‚Äôs impossible to track which image is real.

Each time a creature hits you with an attack roll during the spell‚Äôs duration, roll a d6 for each of your remaining duplicates. If any of the d6s rolls a 3 or higher, one of the duplicates is hit instead of you, and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicates otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the Blinded condition, Blindsight, or Truesight.

level_2_spells.name: Suggestion
level_2_spells.description:
You suggest a course of activity‚Äîdescribed in no more than 25 words‚Äîto one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, ‚ÄúFetch the key to the cult‚Äôs treasure vault, and give the key to me.‚Äù Or you could say, ‚ÄúStop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don‚Äôt return.‚Äù

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.
